title: Financial Planning Assistant / Forecasting
description:
My name is Anna and I am looking for a Financial Planning Assistant for my E-commerce company. 

Your task would be to calculate daily revenue, costs and profits and to provide well-thought forecast of finances and budgeting for the company. In addition, the job would include calculating the financial plan for business and to analyse advertising and extra expense data to make the business as profitable as possible and to provide advice driven from that data.



It will be your task and responsibility to make good sheets and profit calculations to calculate and keep the budgeting well in order for the business and to calculate and keep track of invoices and salaries and to report them to me.

This job will include keeping all the invoice dates and payout calculations on time.



This is a part-time position that requires only 2h/day, 5 days a week in the beginning.

As the business revenue and profits grow, the salary and the working hours will increase.



As Financial Assistant, sometimes other extra tasks like calendar and invoice management and other tasks related to business management will be part of the job to get 2h/day work load.



Overall, your task would be to help me to manage the financial side of the business and to provide important budgeting planning for the business for it to grow and to help me get some tasks of my hands to focus more on other parts of the business for it to grow.



What is required:

-Excellent data analysis skills for budgeting

-Experience in similar tasks

-Good technical skills

-Positive can-do attitude

-Detail Oriented Personality

-Flexible / Dynamic Attitude 

-Excellent Verbal and Communication Skills

-Can work under pressure

-Can work independently virtually



Good to have:

-At least 2 years of experience, but this is not necessary if you are very skilled



When applying for this position, write "FPA Position" in your application headline.



Last application date: 3rd of October 2025.



Let me know more about you and your experience and how you would benefit this business.

title: Project Manager For Marketing Agency
description:
We Are Looking For A Project Manager For Our YouTube Agency



Part-Time - Remote --> Scale To Full-Time As We Grow



What We Do:



At Our Company 
, We run a YouTube agency helping businesses grow their youtube channel and make more sales for their business.



Clients record videos ? we handle everything else (editing, titles, thumbnails, ideas, posting, strategy).



Here are some of our client channels:





















We need a Project Manager to ensure every video moves smoothly through our system and meets a high quality standard.



This role requires strong organization, communication, and quality assurance skills.

You will oversee production across 10–20 active clients, making sure each video is completed accurately and on schedule.



Your Main Job:

Get every client video from “raw video” ? “final approved video” without delays — while maintaining excellent quality.

You will manage:

- Editors

- Strategists (titles & thumbnails)

- Client deliveries

- Quality assurance for all first-draft edited videos



Your Responsibilities

1. Monitor client Slack channels for new video uploads and raw footage



2. Add new videos to our Notion system with all required details (video name, deadlines, posting dates, assigned editor, etc.)



3. Assign videos to editors and notify them in Slack that work has been added to their portal



4. Calculate and set appropriate deadlines based on each client's posting schedule



5. Check in with editors 24-48 hours after assignment to ensure progress is being made



6. Receive first draft videos from editors and send them to our internal reviewer



7. Once reviewed, send the revised version to clients for approval via 
 links



8. Notify editors of any client revisions and ensure changes are made promptly



9. Organize and maintain files across 
 (first drafts and final videos folders) and Google Drive (raw footage, client info, scripts)



10. Keep Notion updated with accurate video statuses throughout the production process (Editing, Review, Client Review, Approved, Uploaded)



11. Upload videos on clients' YouTube channels (add titles, thumbnails, descriptions, timestamps, schedule posting)



12. Ensure all deadlines are met and flag any potential delays proactively





Experience Required:

We are specifically looking for someone with experience in:

- Notion (project management)

- Slack (team communication)

- 
 (video review & feedback)

- Managing multiple editors

- Handling tight deadlines across many projects

- Not Juggling another part-time or full-time role

- Can work 9AM-2PM EST (2PM-6PM GMT) starting off

- 1PM-5PM GMT can also work starting off

- Can Ramp To Full-Time Long-Term (Within 3-6 Months From Starting)



Compensation & Growth

- We want someone long-term, and we reward performance.



Base Salary

- $1000/Month For Part-Time

- $2000/Month For Full-Time





Monthly Incentives / Bonuses

Earn monthly bonuses for:

- Hitting deadlines

- Keeping projects on track



Quarterly Bonuses

- Additional bonuses every quarter.



Long-Term Retention Plans

- Long-term loyalty and performance bonuses as you grow with the team.



How to Apply

If you’re interested in this role, please complete the following steps:

- Send us a short Loom video (2–4 minutes) introducing yourself.





In the Loom, please share:

- Who you are

- Your experience with project management and ideally experience in a similar company

- Why you think you're a good fit for this role

- Why you want a long-term position with growth

- Any past references / company you worked with and what you specifically did in that role

title: AI Software Engineer
description:
Important: Only applications with answered questions sent to 
 with the subject “AI Software Engineer Application” will be considered. We’re excited to see how you could be a perfect fit for our team!



About the Role:

We’re looking for a hands-on AI Software Engineer who’s obsessed with building, experimenting, and exploring what’s next in AI. You’ll collaborate closely with me (an AI Engineer) to develop prototypes, research cutting-edge technologies, and turn bold ideas into working projects - fast.



This isn’t a typical 9-to-5 job. It’s a remote, flexible, full-time role for someone who lives and breathes code, enjoys learning new frameworks or models, and thrives in autonomy. You’ll help research emerging tools, integrate AI systems, and bring experimental ideas to life.





What You’ll Do

 • Rapidly prototype and build AI-powered projects and tools.

 • Research and test new technologies (APIs, frameworks, libraries, or models) — then figure out how they fit into the big picture.

 • Collaborate asynchronously, self-manage tasks, and explore new ideas independently.

 • Contribute to AI projects, apps, and experiments that push creative and technical boundaries.





You’re a Great Fit If You:

 • Are fluent in Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, or similar languages.

 • Have experience working with AI APIs, LLMs, or ML frameworks (OpenAI, Hugging Face, LangChain, etc.).

 • Love building and shipping — not just talking about ideas.

 • Are curious, self-driven, and comfortable working independently.  

 • Understand core app-building principles (frontend/backend, APIs, databases).

 • Enjoy learning, tinkering, and “vibe coding” — building something cool just because it’s fun.





Perks

 • 100% Remote

 • Flexible Hours

 • Constant learning and creative freedom

 • Work on cutting-edge AI projects and experiments





Interview Process

 1. 15-min call — quick intro & vibe check

 2. 30-min coding session — build something or show your favorite project

 3. Offer — we pick the best fit and get started



How to Apply



Please submit:

 1. Your Github

 2. Short answers to the 3 questions below



3 Candidate Questions

 1. What’s the coolest AI or coding project you’ve ever built (or wanted to build)? What inspired it?

 2. When you discover a new AI tool or technology, how do you d
 whether it’s worth integrating or experimenting with?

 3. Describe how you approach building something quickly — from idea to working prototype. What tools or processes do you rely on most?

title: Senior Web Developer with Shopify Experience
description:
Web Developer at House of Designers



Introduction:

Join the creative powerhouse at House of Designers, nestled in the vibrant heart of Orange County, California. We are an esteemed collective of the industry's most talented designers and developers, dedicated to producing groundbreaking graphic design and the latest in web development technology. With a commitment to quality that knows no bounds, we cater to a diverse clientele, offering custom-fit packages that accommodate a vast range of budgets. Our team prides itself on a creative strategy that aligns with our clients' goals, budget, and timeline, ensuring excellence in every project we undertake. If you're ready to contribute to our mission of delivering unparalleled design and development services, we want to hear from you.

Web Developer Job Requirements and Responsibilities:



As a Web Developer at House of Designers, you will:

Design, build, and maintain state-of-the-art websites and applications, ensuring they meet our high standards of quality and creativity.

Shopify experience needed

Collaborate closely with stakeholders and executive management to tailor solutions that exceed expectations.

Craft, revise, and optimize web content with an eye for UI, ensuring seamless cross-browser compatibility.

Address and resolve technical issues, applying innovative problem-solving skills to enhance user experience.

Engage in daily communication with team members, managers, and stakeholders to ensure project alignment.

Utilize a variety of web programming languages and tools, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Shopify, REST, and SOAP, to bring our creative visions to life.

Lead quality assurance testing for interfaces and ensure compliance with industry standards.

Webflow experience highly recommended

AI tools familiarity and being up to date with AI trends and updates on the market

Stay ahead of web development trends, contributing to our culture of continuous learning and improvement.

AI creative tools, creative prompt engineering



Work Hours and Benefits:

This position offers competitive salary, flexible work hours, and the opportunity to work on a variety of exciting projects. Located in Orange County, the role may require occasional travel to support our national client base. Benefits include:

A cutting-edge work environment conducive to innovation and collaboration.

Sponsorship for professional development, including conferences and training.

Exclusive access to our creative resources and software.

A 100% quality guarantee on your work, aligning with our company standards.



Web Developer Skills and Qualifications:

Proven ability to write clean, efficient code and technical documentation.

Expertise in modern HTML/CSS and Shopify.

A knack for creative problem-solving and a keen eye for detail.

Exceptional organizational skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

Experience with network diagnostics and debugging.

Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field.

A minimum of 5 years’ experience in web development, with a portfolio that showcases your talent.





How to Apply:

If you're ready to bring your creativity to the forefront of the industry, submit your resume, portfolio, and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience here in OLJ. Please include the subject line: "Senior Web Developer– [Your Name]."

title: Experienced Video Editors For META Ads (UGC & VSL)
description:
Me and my team are building a brand in the women’s health space, and right now we’re looking to expand our creative team by bringing on another video editor who’s good with
-style VSL ads.



We’re looking for someone who can take a script and turn it into an engaging, fast-paced, retention-focused video.



For each video, your main focus would be:



Finding good clips that match the script throughout the whole video



Making clean edits so everything flows well



Creating and uploading a voiceover of the script we provide (using tools like ElevenLabs), sometimes paired with a HeyGen-style AI character or narrator



We’re looking for people who have experience with tools like this, or something similar. Don’t worry about software costs. Nothing will come out of your pocket.



How it works is pretty straightforward. We give you a 1–3 minute UGC or VSL script, and you edit the full video. On top of that, we’ll usually ask for 2 hook variations, which is basically just the first ~10 seconds tweaked, so it’s not much extra work.



Just to be clear, you wouldn’t be joining the team immediately. We like to try editors out first with a couple paid test batches. You’ll be paid the same as you would be if you were fully on the team for these trials.



After that stage, our goal is to keep editors around long term. If your edits perform well, we bump pay and add bonuses when ads scale. The goal is for you to feel like part of the team, not just someone cranking out random gigs. We move fast and keep things simple.



If this sounds like something you’d be down for, apply with a short intro and a few examples of relevant edits. We’d love to see what you can do.

title: Construction estimator
description:
About Us

Templ Constructions is a residential building company based in Australia specialising in home extensions and renovations. We're looking for a skilled construction estimator to join our team remotely and help us produce accurate, detailed takeoffs and costings across our project pipeline.

The Role

You'll be responsible for quantity takeoffs and trade costings for residential extension and renovation projects. This covers all trades except carpentry labour, which we handle in-house. The volume of work is project-based — some weeks will be busier than others — so we need someone who is comfortable with a flexible arrangement and can manage their time well.

What You'll Be Doing



Reading and interpreting residential construction drawings and specifications to Australian standards

Producing quantity takeoffs for all trades (structural, electrical, plumbing, tiling, plastering, painting, roofing, etc.)

Preparing detailed costings using current Australian supplier and subcontractor rates

Working in Buildxact to produce estimates and material schedules

Communicating with the director to clarify scope, pricing, and project details as needed



What We're Looking For



Experience in construction estimating, ideally for residential projects (extensions, renovations, or new builds)

Familiarity with Australian building standards and the National Construction Code (NCC) is a strong advantage

Proficiency in Buildxact (required) and confidence working with construction drawings

Strong attention to detail — accuracy on takeoffs and costings is critical

Reliable communication in English, both written and verbal

Ability to work independently, manage your own schedule, and meet deadlines

A stable internet connection and a quiet workspace



Nice to Have (Not Required)



Previous experience working with Australian builders or construction companies

Knowledge of Australian supplier pricing (Bunnings Trade, Bowens, CSR, etc.)

Experience with Bluebeam, PlanSwift, or similar takeoff software



How This Works

This is a direct hire arrangement — you'll work directly with the owner/director of Templ Constructions, not through an agency. Work volume is project-based, so hours will flex depending on our pipeline. We're after someone who wants a long-term working relationship, not a one-off gig.

If you're the right fit, we'll start with a paid trial on a couple of real projects so we can both make sure it works before committing to an ongoing arrangement.

To Apply

Send a message with:



A brief summary of your estimating experience, including any Australian residential work

Your experience with Buildxact (or similar estimating software)

Your availability and preferred working hours

Your hourly rate expectation in AUD

title: LinkedIn Brand Partnerships & Outreach Specialist (Commission-Based, Per Deal)
description:
I run a Singapore based LinkedIn account with 17k+ followers, primarily founders, operators, and startup leaders across Singapore and the wider APAC startup ecosystem.



I’m looking for a LinkedIn Brand Partnerships & Outreach Specialist to secure paid brand collaborations with Western B2B startups and SaaS companies (US, UK, Canada, Australia) that want credible visibility in Singapore and APAC.



Each collaboration results in one insight-led LinkedIn post written in my voice.



This role is commission-only, paid per deal closed.



What You’ll Do

-Identify Western B2B startups and SaaS companies relevant to founders and operators

-Reach out to founders, CEOs, Heads of Growth, or Partnerships leads

-Start professional conversations about paid LinkedIn insight collaborations

-Qualify prospects for fit, budget, and intent

-Close deals and get basic content messaging for me to write posts. 

-Track outreach and closed deals in a simple Google Sheet



Target Markets Primary focus

-United States

-United Kingdom

-Canada

-Australia

-Germany 



Target companies

-B2B SaaS or platforms

-Founder-led or growth-stage

-Interested in Singapore or APAC visibility



Compensation

-20% commission per deal closed

-Standard post value: USD 2,000 per post

-Commission per post: USD 400



No cap on number of deals

Example



Who This Role Is For

-Experience in B2B outreach, partnerships, or lead generation

description:
looking for someone to help us test our web/mobile app on a part-time basis.

You have a computer and smartphone with decent internet

You can work at least 20 hours a week

You're reliable and can meet deadlines

title: Studio Operations Coordinator (Book Design Studio – Full-time, Remote)
description:
About Us

We are a small, independent graphic design studio specializing in book cover and interior design. We work with publishers and self-published authors worldwide and collaborate with a distributed team of experienced designers.



We are looking for a reliable, detail-oriented operations coordinator to support our day-to-day workflow and keep projects moving smoothly. This role is execution-focused and suited for someone who enjoys structured work, consistency, and clear processes.



The Role

You will handle daily operational tasks that support client communication, project coordination, and internal follow-ups. Most tasks follow clear templates and established workflows. This is a long-term, stable role focused on execution rather than rapid career acceleration or management growth.



Key Responsibilities

1. Client & Communication Operations

- Respond to client inquiries using provided templates 
, Reedsy, website forms)

- Prepare and send quotations and invoices accurately and on time

- Follow up with clients when responses or actions are pending

- Flag critical or unusual issues for escalation

2. Project & Workflow Coordination

- Set up projects in our project and file management systems

- Follow up with designers on timelines and deliverables

- Ensure information flows smoothly between clients and designers

- Track progress and keep projects moving forward

3. Administrative & Finance Support

- Prepare and organize invoice and expense documentation for accounting

- Support invoice tracking and payment follow-ups

- Maintain organized digital records

4. Operational & Reporting Support

- Collect and organize basic operational data related to client communication, project coordination, and production tracking.

- Maintain simple records and summaries to support internal reporting when needed.

- Assist with basic research or comparisons of tools when requested, following clear guidelines.

- Gather and relay feedback from clients and team members without owning or driving process changes.



What This Role Is (and Is Not)

- IT IS execution-focused, structured, and process-driven.

- IT IS e suited for someone who values stability and clarity.

- It is NOT a strategic, leadership, or management role.

- It is NOT a fast-growth or system-redesign position.



Skills & Experience

- 1.5–3 years experience in operations, coordination, admin, or similar roles

- Strong written English (clear, professional, concise)

- Excellent attention to detail and follow-through

- Comfortable working with repetitive, time-based tasks

- Able to work independently in a remote setup

- Experience in a design studio, creative agency, or publishing environment is a plus.



Tools (experience preferred):

- Project management tools (e.g. ActiveCollab or similar)

- Cloud file systems (Dropbox or similar)

- Invoicing / accounting tools (Xero, QuickBooks, or similar)



Contract & Compensation

- Full-time, long-term independent contractor

- Fixed monthly compensation: USD 800–950, depending on experience

- Contractor is responsible for local taxes and contributions

- Paid time off provided. Local public holidays are observed based on the contractor’s country of residence.



How to Apply

Please send the following to 

- Your CV

- A short cover note explaining why this role fits your working style

title: Front End React Developer
description:
Job Overview

---------



As a React developer, you will implement new features and maintain existing code using React and other standard tools in the React ecosystem, such as Next and Yarn.



Your duties will include designing software solutions to meet project requirements, maintaining and refactoring existing code, writing tests, and fixing bugs.



Examples:

Provide advice and document best practices on proper React implementation.

Assist in troubleshooting efforts and resolving script issues.

Mentor frontends and encourage a pursuit of knowledge in all things related to React development.



Responsibilities and Duties:

---------



Maintain existing React systems, including fixing bugs

Design and develop new custom components to meet project requirements

Install and configure server environments for React deployments

Maintain and update project dependencies as well as fix any conflicts

Working with other JavaScript developers and software engineers to develop front-end and back-end architecture that’s well structured and flexible, along with the APIs to support it





Qualifications:
years implementing the major React components.

Possess leadership skills and be able to work as a leader and developer.

Solid understanding of React workflows.

Good communication skills.

Knowledge of React and common tools used in the wider React ecosystem, such as Next, Node.js and yarn

Familiarity with common programming tools such as Redux, IDEs, GraphQL, RESTful APIs, Git repositories, TypeScript, version control software, and remote deployment tools

An understanding of common programming paradigms and fundamental React principles, such as React components, hooks, and the React lifecycle



Technical Qualifications
+ years in frontend development and strong React experience.

Graphic design and user experience background.

Understanding of content organization and concepts within information architecture.

Frontend and standard Internet protocols, cross-browser, XML, HTML, HTTP, XHTML, CSS + preprocessors (SASS/LESS/etc), JavaScript (a.k.a. plain or raw), Ajax, React, Redux, Next or other JS frameworks.

Strong experience with GraphQL and RESTful APIs

Familiarity with basic Magento functionality (API = must)

title: IT Delivery & Program Coordinator
description:
IT Delivery & Program Coordinator

Department: Technology

Location: Remote

Employment Type: Full-Time

Job Summary

We are seeking a highly organized and execution-focused IT Delivery and Program Coordinator to support the reliable delivery of technology initiatives across our core platform.

This role is responsible for coordinating day-to-day execution across internal stakeholders and external development partners, ensuring work progresses smoothly from scope through build, QA, and release. The ideal candidate thrives in structured environments, follows through consistently, and proactively identifies and resolves blockers.

This is a delivery coordination role and does not include product strategy or technical architecture responsibilities.

 

Key Responsibilities

• Maintain and update project tracking tools, delivery boards, and milestone plans

• Monitor timelines, dependencies, and risks across active technology initiatives

• Follow up with internal teams and external vendors to ensure timely execution

• Coordinate QA cycles, testing schedules, and release readiness activities

• Organize and document delivery meetings, action items, and progress updates

• Ensure clear visibility into active workstreams and issue status

• Escalate risks and delays appropriately to leadership

• Maintain documentation of systems, ownership, and active initiatives

 

Qualifications

Required:

• 2 to 5 years of experience in project coordination, program support, IT operations, or related roles

• Strong organizational and time management skills

• Experience working with external vendors or technical teams

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills

• Ability to manage multiple workstreams simultaneously

• Strong attention to detail and follow-through

Preferred:

• Experience working in technology, SaaS, or platform-based environments

• Familiarity with project management tools such as Jira, Asana, Trello, or ClickUp

• Experience coordinating QA or release processes

• Basic understanding of the software development lifecycle

 

Skills and Competencies

• Proactive problem-solving

• Structured thinking and documentation discipline

• Comfort operating in evolving or ambiguous environments

• Strong stakeholder coordination skills

• Accountability and reliability

 

What Success Looks Like

• Clear and consistent visibility into delivery progress

• Early identification of risks and blockers

• Structured and predictable vendor coordination

• Organized QA and release processes

• Reduced last-minute escalations and delivery surprises

 

Reporting Structure

This role reports to the Senior Director of Technology & AI Strategy and works closely with internal stakeholders and external development partners.

Hi, my name is Ryan.



I’m looking for a skilled YouTube editor who can heavily edit Roblox videos in a modern, high-energy American YouTube style.



Reference video (very important):





This is the level of editing I’m looking for from start to finish — not just a catchy intro.



What I’m looking for:



Heavy editing throughout the entire video



Fast cuts, strong pacing, lots of visual movement



Animations, motion graphics, visual effects, subtitles, images popping in



No long static moments or simple “cut-only” edits



Ability to make jokes, rare moments, and interesting points more visual

Examples of similar work



Your usual turnaround time

Ryan

What You’ll Do For JJCo

As an Audit Manager, you will lead engagements from planning through wrap-up, working side-by-side with partners as a hands-on, “working auditor.” You will:



Plan, supervise, and complete multiple audit engagements for a diverse portfolio of not-for-profit clients—charitable organizations, foundations, and associations—while managing deadlines, budgets, and engagement profitability.

Mentor and review the work of audit seniors and associates, fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional growth.

Review and approve workpapers, financial statements, and audit reports to ensure accuracy, GAAS compliance, and adherence to not-for-profit accounting standards (FASB ASC 958).

Stay ahead of regulatory changes affecting the nonprofit sector and advise clients on accounting issues, internal controls, and best practices throughout the year—not just during audit weeks.

Develop lasting client relationships by serving as a trusted advisor and responsive resource long after fieldwork ends.

Contribute to business development by preparing proposals, networking with industry peers, making public presentations, and recruiting new team members.

Participate in firm initiatives such as training, recruiting, and diversity-and-inclusion efforts, helping shape the direction of the Audit Department and the firm overall.

You’ll also have the freedom to cultivate your professional network at conferences and continuing-education events alongside firm leaders. While there is a clear path to partner, there is no pressure to pursue that goal—you set your own trajectory.



What We Will Do For You

Professional growth every year: You’ll take part in firm-sponsored training, mentoring, and industry conferences, keeping your technical skills and leadership toolkit sharp.

A voice at the table: Beyond client work, you’ll help shape firm initiatives—training programs, recruiting, and diversity-and-inclusion efforts—so your ideas directly influence how we operate and serve the nonprofit community.

Choose your trajectory: There is a clear route to partner, but no pressure to pursue it; we support the career path that fits your goals.

title: Client Success Manager, Digital Marketing
description:
About Us:

At Local Comets, we specialize in helping home services companies grow through cutting-edge digital marketing strategies. Our focus is on driving growth in recurring clients through platforms like
, Instagram, and Google. We don’t stop there—we also offer lead follow-up services to ensure our clients see real, measurable growth.



Our mission is to become the #1 Growth Partner for home services companies in the US. If you’re looking for a role that allows you to make an impact, work autonomously, and solve problems creatively, this might be the perfect opportunity for you!



Why Join Local Comets?

Dynamic Challenges: No two days are the same. Every day presents new challenges and opportunities for you to take initiative and make a difference.



Ownership & Responsibility: This isn’t just about doing what you’re told. We want someone who can figure things out, take ownership, and continuously improve how we support clients.



Collaborative Team Culture: We support each other fiercely while ensuring we all succeed as a team.



Performance-Based Growth: Potential to be rewarded for your success with performance bonuses tied to client satisfaction and upsell opportunities.



What You’ll Do

As a Client Success Manager, you will serve as the key point of contact for our clients, helping them achieve their business goals through strategic digital marketing solutions. You’ll take ownership of your client relationships, problem-solve on the go, and continuously find ways to optimize results.



Key Responsibilities:

Client Satisfaction: Ensure clients receive top-notch service and support, while always striving for maximum satisfaction.



Resourcefulness & Autonomy: When faced with a challenge, you won’t just ask for help—you’ll find the solution. Whether it’s learning a new tool, understanding a client's needs, or solving an unexpected issue, you take initiative.



Relationship Building: Become a trusted partner to clients, building long-lasting relationships that drive both retention and growth.



Data-Driven Strategy: Analyze campaign data to provide actionable recommendations that improve performance and ensure clients hit their goals.



Upsell & Retention: Strategically introduce clients to additional services to enhance their success while retaining their business.



Who You Are:

Independent Problem-Solver: You excel at figuring things out and take initiative to learn and improve.



Digital Marketing Enthusiast: You have a strong interest in digital marketing, with experience in
, Instagram, Google, and TikTok ads.



Data-Driven Thinker: You enjoy analyzing data, identifying trends, and developing strategic recommendations based on insights.



Excellent Communicator: Your communication skills are top-notch, both written and verbal, and you know how to build strong relationships with clients.



Collaborative Spirit: You thrive in a team environment and understand the importance of working well with others to achieve shared goals.



Qualifications:

Experience: 3+ years in client success, account management, or digital marketing (home services industry experience is a bonus).



Problem-Solving: You’re resourceful and find solutions independently without needing step-by-step guidance.



Tech-Savvy: Proficiency in CRM systems, analytics tools, and marketing automation software is a plus.



Strategic Thinker: You’re able to think long-term, develop strategies for success, and execute on them effectively.



Management Style:

At Local Comets, we believe in empowering our team to take ownership of their work. We set high expectations but always provide the support, resources, and guidance necessary to achieve them. We encourage innovation, proactive problem-solving, and collaboration across all levels of the business.



NOTE: YOU MUST SUBMIT A 60 - 90 second video that explains your relevant experience. No candidates will be considered that do not submit this.

title: Vacation Rental Systems Assistant
description:
This position serves as a virtual assistant role focused on onboarding new properties into our systems and content management for STR Management, a vacation rental management company based in Austin, TX. The ideal candidate is highly organized, process-driven, independent, and self-motivated. Strong experience with Hostaway is preferred, as is proficiency with Google Drive, Google Docs, and Google Sheets. Experience with HTML and FTP is a plus. Fluency in English is a must, and the candidate should be available for work hours that overlap with USA business hours.



Key Responsibilities

• Create a Google Drive folder and internal property sheet for each new property.

• Set up the property in Hostaway and enter all required property details.

• Coordinate and schedule property photography.

• Upload and organize property photos in Google Drive and Hostaway.

• Build the initial property listing, including descriptions, amenities, and photo order.

• Optimize listing content for SEO and AI-based search visibility used by modern travelers.

• Coordinate with copywriting and marketing teams to finalize listing content.

• Publish listings to connected channels, including Airbnb, Vrbo, Booking.com, and more.

• Set up Lynx smart home technology as part of the onboarding process.

• Create and maintain property documentation such as House Manuals and pre-arrival content.

• Assist with inventory tracking and purchasing of household items.

• Monitor listings post-launch and make updates for accuracy, seasonal changes, or platform requirements.

• Regularly review listings to apply platform updates and ensure all listings remain active.



> Qualifications

• Extensive experience with Google Drive, Google Docs, and Google Sheets.

• Knowledge of HTML and FTP is required.

• Experience with Hostaway preferred.

• Must be fluent in English.

• Ability to work independently and self-manage.

• Highly organized and detail-oriented, with strong accuracy across multiple systems.

• Comfortable following structured processes, checklists, and established workflows.

• Ability to adapt quickly to new tools, platform updates, and changing requirements.

• Ability to work flexible hours to maximize overlap with U.S. (CT) business hours.

• Working knowledge of SEO principles and how AI-driven search tools are used to discover vacation rentals, with the ability to optimize listing content accordingly.



> To apply:

1. Resume/CV: A detailed resume showcasing your relevant experience, especially in virtual assistance and content management.



2. Examples of Property Listings: If you have experience with Hostaway or similar platforms (Airbnb, VRBO, etc.), please provide links or screenshots of property listings you’ve created or managed.



3. Google Sheets/Docs Samples: Since organizational skills are crucial for this role, please share an example of a Google Sheet or Google Doc you’ve created that demonstrates your ability to manage information (e.g., property management sheets, onboarding processes, or inventory management). You can redact any sensitive information if needed.



4. Experience with HTML and FTP (if applicable): If you have worked with HTML or FTP, please share any relevant examples of websites, files, or projects where you used these skills.



5. Availability: Please share your availability, particularly your ability to work hours that overlap with U.S. (CT) business hours.



6. Ideal Hourly Rate: Please provide your ideal hourly rate of pay.

title: Property Manager Assistant / Executive Assistant (Real Estate)
description:
I’m hiring a highly organized, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to serve as my Property Manager Assistant and help manage the administrative operations of my real estate business. This role is designed to free up my time by taking ownership of recurring admin, bookkeeping coordination, inbox management, compliance tracking, vendor payments, broker coordination, and marketing support.



This is a long-term role, not a beginner position. You will be handling multiple entities, properties, financial records, and sensitive information. The right candidate is proactive, systems-driven, and comfortable working independently with daily check-ins.



Responsibilities include organizing and maintaining all files in Google Drive (entities, properties, expenses, invoices, taxes), managing and cleaning inboxes daily, paying invoices and setting up autopays, processing invoices and reimbursements in QuickBooks, organizing expenses by entity and property, assisting with tax prep and annual LLC filings, coordinating with property managers and brokers, conducting daily property searches, scheduling meetings, managing calendars and travel, and supporting website updates, marketing, social media, and internal systems documentation.



Part-time to start with opportunity to grow. Daily check-in required.



To apply: include a brief description of your QuickBooks experience (years, versions, and tasks handled, if any) and make sure the subject line of your application reads: “Property Manager Assistant – LFO.” Applications without this subject line will not be reviewed.



Required: QuickBooks experience, excellent organization and attention to detail, clear written communication, and the ability to manage multiple workflows without constant direction.



Preferred: real estate or property management experience, website or social media support, basic HTML/PHP.

title: Short-Form Video Editor
description:
We are Remodel Magnate, a performance-based agency specializing in the wet-area remodeling niche. We are looking for a high-level Video Editor who doesn’t just cut footage, but creates stories that sell.



Initially, this is a part-time role focused on high-quality short-form content. However, we are looking for a long-term partner. Within a few months, this will transition into a full-time role covering YouTube long-form, short-form, and content management.



What We’re Looking For:



- Extreme Initiative: If you need a timestamp-by-timestamp breakdown of what to do, this is not the role for you. We need someone who can take a rawscript or video and find the story. You should be able to work without detailed task breakdowns.



- The Aesthetic: You understand clean, professional, and engaging editing. We aren't looking for "techno/gamer" vibes or over-the-top motion graphics. We need smooth transitions, perfect pacing, and intentional overlays.



- High-Level Research & Resourcefulness: If a script mentions a specific concept or quote, you don't wait for us to send the file. You find it. You know how to source high-quality, non-stock, non-cringy b-roll and assets.



- The "Extra Step" Mindset: We want an editor who thinks: "How can I make this better?" (e.g., finding a perfect sound effect, generating a realistic AI voice for a quote, or adding a subtle visual that reinforces the point, etc).



- Flawless English: You must have a strong command of English to ensure there are zero spelling or grammatical errors in captions and overlays.



Responsibilities:



- Edit high-retention short-form videos (Reels/TikTok/Shorts).



- Independent asset sourcing (finding relevant b-roll, images, and clips).



- Quality control: Ensuring every frame is intentional and free of mistakes.



- (Future) YouTube long-form editing and platform posting.



Requirements:



- Portfolio demonstrating a clean, professional "Business/Creator" editing style (similar to Kallaway).



- Ability to work independently and meet deadlines without reminders.



- A perfectionist eye for detail.



How to Apply: 

1. 
 -
 me with the subject line: Short-Form Editor - [Your Name] 

2. Link your portfolio

3. Describe why you're a strong fit and what's your vision for this project.

4. List the specific software/tools you use for editing and asset sourcing.

title: Sales and Admin Assistant
description:
Are you a highly organized, tech-savvy professional who thrives in a fast-paced environment? We’re seeking a proactive Remote Lead Scheduler & Admin Assistant to support a busy US-based construction company. In this role, you will be the central hub connecting our project managers with qualified leads, while ensuring the behind-the-scenes admin runs smoothly. You must be able to work during US business hours and are comfortable working on weekends if needed. You will be paid on a weekly basis + HMO.





Responsibilities:



- Inbound/Outbound Lead Follow-up: Promptly contact and qualify new leads via phone,
, and text



- Schedule Coordination: Book appointments, site visits, and estimates between clients and project managers



- CRM Management: Accurately input lead details, update statuses, and track communication logs



- Customer Screening: Vet potential clients to ensure projects fit the company’s scope and service area



- Daily Admin Support: Manage
 inboxes, draft correspondence, and organize digital files/job folders



- Process Improvement: Identify bottlenecks in the lead-to-estimate process and suggest efficiency hacks



Qualification & Experience Requirements:



- Minimum 2 years of experience in administrative support, scheduling, or customer service (construction or trade industry experience preferred)



- Fluent in English (written and oral) with a neutral or US-friendly accent



- Experience working with CRM software (e.g., JobNimbus, Buildertrend, HubSpot, or Salesforce)



- Tech-savvy: Comfortable using VoIP phone systems, Google Workspace/MS Office, and project management tools



- Detail-oriented with the ability to juggle multiple calendars and changing priorities



Reliable high-speed internet and a quiet home office setup



Preferred Skills:



- Familiarity with the US construction/home services industry (e.g., roofing, remodeling, HVAC, or general contracting)



- Experience handling high call volumes and SMS/text-based customer communication



- Self-starter who requires minimal supervision and takes ownership of tasks



- Calm under pressure and able to problem-solve when schedules conflict



- Professional, patient, and courteous when dealing with homeowners and trade partners



- Available to start immediately and work Monday–Friday during US time zones (EST/CST preferred)

description:
Are you a creative visual storyteller with a passion for crafting eye-catching and engaging video content? If so, we want you to join our team at House of Designers!

House of Designers is a creative agency renowned for pushing the boundaries of media content. We specialize in delivering top-tier, edgy video content that captivates audiences and leaves a lasting impression. Our team is driven by a commitment to quality and creativity, and we're on the lookout for a talented Video Editor to add their unique touch to our projects.



Position: Senior Video Editor and Motion Graphics Editor with 3D experience



Responsibilities:

Edit and assemble raw footage into visually compelling stories that align with our brand and client objectives.

Collaborate closely with our creative team to understand project requirements and deliver content that exceeds expectations.

Bring fresh, innovative ideas to the table, contributing to the overall creative process.

Stay up-to-date with industry trends and techniques to enhance the quality and uniqueness of our video content.

Work efficiently to meet project deadlines without compromising on the quality of the final product.



Qualifications & Requirements:

Proven experience as a Video Editor with a strong portfolio showcasing your editing skills and creative flair.

Proficiency in industry-standard editing and 3D software (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, After Effects, Blender, Maya and/or 4D Max).

Experience in Graphic Design and proficiency in graphic design tools (Adobe Creative Suite, Illustrator, Sketch, Figma).

Understanding of storytelling, pacing, and visual aesthetics.

Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Excellent communication skills and a keen eye for detail.

5+ years of professional video editing experience.

AI creative tools, creative prompt engineering



What We Offer:

Opportunities for professional growth and development.

Competitive salary.

The chance to work on exciting projects with leading brands.



How to Apply:

House of Designers

title: Equipment Technician
description:
1. Ensures that all machines and production equipment run smoothly to meet schedules



2. Monitors machine performance and equipment being used in the production line and respond immediately to any machine trouble that may arise such as but not limited to machine parameter



3. Makes countermeasure report for problems encountered, conduct analysis and make recommendations to prevent re-occurrence of the problem



4. Makes recommendations and suggestions on productivity and machine improvement and proceed improvement action



5. Support production on relay-out plans, physical set-up, machines, tables and other equipment in the production line



6. Equipment installation, maintenance, repair and troubleshooting



General knowledge on operation, repair and maintenance of machine



7. Monitoring of machine performance such as but not limited to laser machine, data gathering and calibration



Requirements:



1. Graduate of a Technology course or college level in an engineering course



2. At least 1 year work experience as a maintenance/ equipment or production technician in a semiconductor/electronics manufacturing company. Fresh graduates are welcome to apply



3. Knowledge on programmable logic control (PLC) and electromechanical set - up.



4. Knowledge on equipment installation, maintenance, repair and troubleshooting



5. Able to read and interpret schematic eletro-mechanical diagram/ engineering drawings



6. Knowledge on machines (winding and molding machines) and tools including their design, uses, repair and maintenance)



7. Knowledge in stamping machine is an advantage but not required

title: Sales Representative
description:
Send your resume to 



A Sales Representative promotes and sells a company's products/services by identifying leads, understanding customer needs, presenting solutions, negotiating deals, and closing sales, acting as the key link between the business and its clients to drive revenue, build relationships, and meet sales targets (quotas). Key duties involve lead generation (cold calls, referrals), product demos, contract management, customer relationship building, and market analysis, requiring excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills. 

Key Responsibilities:

• Prospecting & Lead Generation: Find potential clients through cold calling, networking, or marketing leads.

• Customer Engagement: Conduct product presentations, answer questions, and provide demonstrations

.

• Sales Negotiation: Discuss terms, handle objections, and finalize contracts.

• Relationship Management: Maintain strong connections with existing and new customers.

• Goal Achievement: Consistently meet or exceed weekly, monthly, and annual sales quotas.

• Reporting: Document sales activities, manage records, and report on performance. 



Qualifications:



• A bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or any related field.

• At least 2–5 years of experience in sales.

• Experience relevant to the company’s products or services is preferred.

• Proven experience in a sales role, with a demonstrated track record of achieving sales targets.

• Strong negotiation skills and ability to close deals.

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

• Deep understanding of customer needs and a focus on providing value-driven solutions.

• Strong problem-solving skills for addressing customer complaints or concerns.

• Familiarity with CRM software, sales reporting tools, and other relevant business technologies.

• Basic knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) for reporting and presentations.

• Willing to travel extensively in all areas of Luzon. 



SEND your CVs to:

title: Marketing & Content Creator
description:
The Role:



This is a hybrid marketing + content creation role. You’ll manage our social media presence, plan and execute content strategy, AND create short-form video content (TikToks, Reels, Shorts) for our apps. You’re the full package — you can think strategically about what to post and when, but you can also open CapCut, record a voiceover, and make a video that actually performs. You’ll be working across multiple apps, so the work stays varied and interesting.



What You’ll Do



Content Creation (50%)

• Create 6–12 short-form videos per month across our app portfolio (TikTok, Reels, Shorts)

• Produce gameplay clips, screen recordings with voiceover, app walkthroughs, and trending format content

• Stay on top of TikTok/Reels trends, sounds, and hooks in the gaming and app space

• Adapt your content style for different apps — a game needs different energy than a utility app

• Deliver raw and edited video files for repurposing across platforms



Marketing & Social Media Management (40%)

• Manage and grow Degen Game Studios’ social media accounts (TikTok, Instagram, X/Twitter, YouTube)

• Build and maintain a content calendar across all apps and platforms

• Schedule and publish content using tools like Buffer, Later, or similar

• Monitor and respond to community engagement — comments, DMs, app reviews

• Research trending hashtags, sounds, and content formats relevant to our apps

• Identify influencer and cross-promotion opportunities



Analytics & Growth (10%)

• Track key metrics: downloads, engagement rates, follower growth, video performance

• Assist with App Store Optimization (ASO) for both App Store and Google Play — keyword research, screenshot ideas, description updates

• Help set up and monitor basic paid ad campaigns when needed (Apple Search Ads, Meta Ads)

• Provide a brief monthly summary of what’s working and what to try next



Requirements

• 1–2+ years of experience in social media marketing, content creation, or both

• Strong portfolio of short-form video content (TikTok, Reels, or Shorts) — share your work

• Comfortable with voiceover and screen recording (face on camera optional, voice required)

• Proficient with video editing tools (CapCut, Premiere, DaVinci, or similar)

• Understanding of what performs on TikTok and Reels — hooks, pacing, trending formats

• Experience with social media scheduling and analytics tools

• Strong written communication and ability to work independently

• Genuine interest in mobile gaming, apps, or tech content



Nice to Have

• Experience marketing mobile apps or games on iOS and Android

• Existing audience in the mobile gaming or app review niche

• Familiarity with ASO for both App Store and Google Play

• Experience with Apple Search Ads or Meta Ads Manager

• Basic graphic design skills (Canva, Figma, etc.)

• Experience managing multiple products or brands simultaneously



Why This Role

• Get in on the ground floor of a growing indie studio with multiple titles in the pipeline

• Creative freedom — you’ll shape the brand voice and content strategy from scratch

• Flexible, remote, part-time schedule that works around your life

• Opportunity to grow with the studio as we scale — more apps, bigger budgets, more responsibility

title: Experienced Project Manager (Amazon FBA | Remote | Full-Time)
description:
Join a Fast-Growing E-Commerce Brand Based in Singapore



Dear Applicants,



We are a fast-growing e-commerce company based in Singapore, expanding our presence on Amazon FBA. We’re looking for a sharp, detail-oriented Project Manager to support and grow our Amazon operations together with us. You’ll play a key role in keeping things running smoothly behind the scenes.



This is a hands-on role with a clear structure and HIGH expectations. We’re looking for EXPERIENCED candidates only—someone familiar with the Amazon backend who knows how to get things done without constant supervision.



What You'll Be Doing

- managing a team of 6

- Assist with shipping plans and coordinate with suppliers, freight forwarders, and inspection agents

- Support and review product listings, ensuring keywords, images, and backend details are optimized

-Manage and track inventory, monitor campaign results, and update spreadsheets and dashboards

- Coordinate tasks with our design, listing, and operations teams

- Participate in internal training sessions, including AI workflow videos

- Handle writing product listings, inventory planning, and data tracking

- Contribute to operational improvements and project planning

- confirm product details, know product size tiers.



Tools You’ll Use

Amazon Seller Central

Google Drive (Sheets, Docs)

Notion (Team Communication)

Helium 10

DataDive

Zoom



Requirements

- 5 years of relevant project/team management experience, ideally in Amazon FBA

- Experience with Amazon listings, inventory tracking, and backend operations

- STRONG attention to detail and ability to communicate those details with teams and stakeholders

- Able to work independently and adapt quickly to changing priorities

- Excellent problem-solving and coordination skills

- Strong analytical, strategic, and communication skills

- Open-minded, proactive, and a team player



Working Hours

Monday to Friday, 12 PM – 10 PM (SGT) (with 1 hour break)

44 hours per week | Remote work



To Apply, Please Include the Following:

- A short introduction about yourself and why you're a good fit for this role

- Reference links to your portfolio or past Amazon FBA work

- A brief explanation of why you left your last role or what you were doing before applying

- A video introduction is highly encouraged and will be prioritized

- Please highlight your Amazon FBA experience clearly in your message



IMPORTANT:

Only applicants with Amazon FBA experience will be considered

Applications without reference links or relevant experience will not be entertained

If you are new or require training on the above tasks, please do not apply.



Looking forward to building something great together.

title: Content Feedback Manager (Giving Feedback): $1,000–$1,200 USD START RATE
description:
Start rate: $800 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,000–$1,200 a month)



Paid twice per month via Wise.



ABOUT US







Young Publisher is an international digital marketing company working with content creators and online brands.



BENEFITS

- Full-time position: 8 hours daily, Monday-Friday; 40 hours a week

- Flexible schedule: Choose your own hours, as long as you show up for the daily meeting (MANDATORY)

- Stable income: Long-term role with regular, on-time payments

- Supportive team: Collaborative environment without micromanagement

- Growth path: Opportunities to increase responsibilities and earnings

- 100% remote: Work-from-home setup



TASKS



- Content & Client Feedback

- Review 30-60 short-form client videos (Instagram Reels, TikTok, YouTube Shorts) per day in our Slack feedback channel -before they are published

- Give constructive, actionable feedback on hooks (verbal/headline/visual), scripting, pacing, editing, and CTA, making sure each client knows exactly how to improve

- Cross-reference each piece of content with client niche, experience, and goals as outlined in their files

- Review previous feedback to ensure consistency and avoid contradictions

- Quality-control content ideas created by our Content Research Experts before delivery to the client, ensuring fit with niche, experience, and likely performance

- Oversee workload balance among Content Research Experts and make sure no one on the team is overloaded or underutilized

- Respond to client questions or tech issues in Slack within 24 hours

- Be tough but fair—only approve content that meets quality standards



Progress Tracking



- Complete daily End-of-Day (EOD) reports

- Attend daily tea
eting (mandatory, 3pm CET)

- Keep internal feedback and client progress records up to date



REQUIREMENTS (MUST-HAVE)

- C1+ English (written), with perfect grammar and clear, professional responses

- Significant experience creating or reviewing short-form content for Instagram Reels, TikTok, or YouTube Shorts

- Organized and detail-oriented

- Reliable internet and a quiet, professional home workspace

- Accountability mindset and deadline commitment

- Long-term commitment, eager to master a workflow and have direct impact on client success



IMPORTANT



- When recording a Loom video as part of your application:

- Camera must show your FACE & SCREEN

- Treat it as a LIVE interview with the Hiring Manager

- Have a professional background

- Have clear audio

- Wear business-casual attire



BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED)



- Experience supporting creators and social media beginners, especially ages 45+

- Familiarity with AI tools like ChatGPT, CapCut, etc.

- Strong understanding of trends/strategy for Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts



WHY JOIN US?



- Start rate: $800 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,000–$1,200 a month once trained)

Note: Senior CFMs earn $1,500+ after 6–12 months.

- Performance bonuses: Up to $400+ additional monthly based on:

- Quality and clarity of feedback

- Task completion and consistency

- Teamwork and responsibility

- Payments: Twice per month via Wise, direct to your bank

- Tools access: All tools/software fully covered

- Work-life balance: No graveyard shifts

- Professional growth: Frequent feedback and advanced training



HOW TO APPLY



1: Message us on OnlineJobs.ph with "CFM" as the message title



2: Include ONLY the following in your message:



#1: Your CV.

#2: Your years of experience with short-form content.

#3: Your years of experience with content feedback or coaching.

#4: One sentence on why you're a good fit for this role.

#5: Your portfolio (including examples of your feedback or video/content work).



Note: Messages that do not follow this format will NOT be reviewed.

title: Mortgage Cold Calling & Loan Officer Assistant (Remote)
description:
We are looking for a long term, full time virtual assistant from the Philippines to help with cold calling, lead follow up, and simple admin work for a U.S. mortgage business. This is a stable role with clear tasks and training provided.



About the role

You will spend most of your time calling leads (new, old, and past clients) to find people interested in refinancing or getting a new home loan. You will ask basic questions, gather simple information, and set appointments for the lead mortgage loan originator. You will not sell or give loan advice; you will focus on calling, gathering info, and organizing the leads.



Main responsibilities

• Make outbound calls to a list of leads each day (cold and warm leads).

• Ask a short list of simple questions (reason for loan, timing, basic income range, property plans, etc.).

• Identify who is interested and set appointments for the lead mortgage originator.

• Take clear notes from each call and update the CRM with status (interested, follow?up, not interested, wrong number, etc.).

Spend a small part of each day learning basic information about mortgage loan programs so you can ask better questions over time.

What we are looking for

• Strong spoken English and clear, friendly phone manner.

• Comfortable making many outbound calls every day.

• Good listening skills and accurate note?taking.

• Reliable internet, a quiet place to work, and a good headset.

• Organized, follows instructions, and open to feedback.

• Willing to learn about the U.S. mortgage process over time.

title: Amazon Graphic Design Expert
description:
We are a fast-growing Amazon agency working with multiple brands to scale their presence and profitability on Amazon. Our team moves quickly, operates at a high level, and is focused on execution. We are looking for a highly skilled Amazon Graphic Design Expert who can produce premium, conversion-focused creative at scale using AI and modern design tools.



This is not an entry-level role. We need someone who understands Amazon, understands buyers, and can consistently produce high-impact creative assets without relying on traditional product photography.



What You’ll Be Responsible For



You will be the creative engine behind listing visuals across multiple brands. Your main objective is to produce clean, high-converting, Amazon-compliant visual assets quickly and consistently.



Responsibilities include:



Designing high-quality Amazon listing images that drive conversions



Creating A+ Content layouts that enhance brand storytelling and credibility



Building Brand Store creative assets (banners, section visuals, infographics)



Using AI tools to generate lifestyle images without the need for photography



Producing infographics that clearly communicate product value and features



Creating comparison charts, feature callouts, and benefit-driven visuals



Maintaining visual consistency across entire product lines



Delivering assets fast while maintaining premium quality standards



We are looking for someone who can “pump out” strong creative at scale without sacrificing quality.



AI Skills Are Required (This Is a Must)



You MUST have hands-on experience using AI tools to create Amazon listing images and lifestyle scenes.



You should be comfortable:



Generating product lifestyle scenes using AI



Enhancing product photos using AI tools



Creating compliant backgrounds and environments without photography



Using AI to speed up design workflows and ideation



You will be expected to prove your ability to use AI to produce Amazon-compliant creative that looks real, clean, and professional.



Required Experience



You must have strong, proven experience with:



Amazon listing image design



A+ Content creation



Brand Store layout design



Canva (expert level required)



Photoshop or equivalent tools



AI image generation tools (examples: Midjourney, DALL-E, Photoshop AI, etc.)



You should already understand:



Amazon image compliance rules



What makes a listing image convert



How to structure visuals for clarity and impact



How to design for mobile shoppers



What We’re Looking For



We want someone who is:



FAST and efficient



Detail-oriented



Highly creative



Self-motivated



Comfortable taking direction and executing quickly



Hungry to improve and grow



Most importantly, we want someone who takes pride in producing elite-level work.



How to Apply (Required)



To be considered, you MUST include:



A portfolio of Amazon listing images you’ve created



Examples of A+ Content you’ve designed



Examples of Brand Store creative (if available)



A short explanation of which AI tools you use and how you use them



Before/after examples showing AI-generated lifestyle images



Applications without proof of Amazon experience and AI usage will not be considered.

title: Data Analyst (Google Sheets / Looker Studio / BigQuery) – Trial Project with Ongoing Opportunity
description:
We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to help us build clear, actionable dashboards to track and display company performance metrics. This role will start as a paid trial project using a small, defined dataset, with the intention of selecting the strongest candidate for an ongoing, long-term engagement.



You will work with real operational data and be responsible for organizing, analyzing, and presenting metrics in a way that is intuitive for leadership review.



Trial Project Scope

The initial trial project will include:

• 8 data files (2024 Q1–Q4 and 2025 Q1–Q4)

• Each file contains New Patient (NP) and retention data for all practitioners

• Data spans multiple departments and practitioners



Trial Deliverables

For the trial project, you will be expected to:

• Consolidate the 8 files into a clean, structured dataset

• Create views that allow performance review by individual practitioner across multiple years

• Display practitioner rankings at both the company level and department level

• Present the data in a clear, executive-friendly format (Google Sheets, Looker Studio, or similar)

• Clearly explain your data structure and logic



Creativity and clarity in how the data is presented are encouraged.



Tools & Skills Required

• Strong proficiency in Google Sheets (advanced formulas, pivot tables, data structuring)

• Experience with Looker Studio or similar BI / dashboard tools

• Strong data organization and visualization skills

• Ability to work with imperfect or real-world datasets

• Clear written communication



Selection Process

We plan to hire multiple candidates for this paid trial project.

The candidate who delivers the strongest, clearest, and most scalable solution will be offered ongoing work to maintain and expand company dashboards and reporting.



Ongoing Work (Post-Trial)

• Building and maintaining dashboards

• Adding new datasets and metrics

• Improving reporting efficiency and automation

• Long-term collaboration with leadership



How to Apply

Please include:

• A brief description of your experience with Google Sheets and dashboards

• Examples of previous dashboards or reports (screenshots or links preferred)

• Confirmation that you are comfortable completing a short paid trial project

title: Design Assistant
description:
More Casual / Freelancer-Friendly Version

We’re looking for a graphic design assistant to help create packaging artwork for a variety of products, including designs applied to 3D objects. You’ll be assisting with layout, visual development, and preparing final artwork that’s ready to send straight to suppliers for production.

This role is ideal for someone with strong packaging experience who understands print requirements and can turn concepts into clean, production-ready files. Will be working with a small team consisting of myself, and another Filipino worker. 



Please send resume.

title: Junior Landscape Draftsman (2D / 3D / Rendering) – International Projects
description:
We’re looking for a Junior Landscape Draftsman who can support our team with 2D drafting, 3D modeling, and rendering for international landscape projects (US, AU, UK, and more).



You’ll work closely with senior designers and project leads to turn concepts into clear, buildable drawings and compelling visuals. If you love landscape design, are detail-oriented, and want daily exposure to global standards, this role is for you.



Key Responsibilities

 • Prepare 2D landscape drawings (plans, elevations, sections, details) using CAD software.

 • Build 3D landscape models (e.g., SketchUp or similar) based on design briefs and CAD files.

 • Produce high-quality renders and presentation images for client submissions.

 • Update and revise drawings based on markups, redlines, and feedback from senior staff.

 • Assist in organizing drawing sets for tender, construction, and presentation purposes.

 • Maintain clean file structures, layer standards, and naming conventions.

 • Coordinate with project managers to meet deadlines across different time zones.



Qualifications

 • 1–3 years of experience as a Landscape Draftsman, CAD Technician, or similar role

(Strong fresh grads with solid portfolios are welcome to apply).

 • Proficiency in 2D CAD (AutoCAD or similar).

 • Working knowledge of 3D modeling (preferably SketchUp).

 • Experience in rendering (Lumion, D5, Enscape, V-Ray, or similar) is a big plus.

 • Basic understanding of:

 • Landscape / site plans

 • Planting plans

 • Hardscape layouts

 • Levels / grading and details

 • Strong attention to detail and ability to follow standards and templates.

 • Comfortable working with foreign clients and communicating in English (written and spoken).

 • Willingness to learn fast, receive feedback, and grow into a more senior role over time.



Compensation, Credits & Growth

 • Starting (Probationary): ?18,000/month

 • With good performance, salary can grow to ?40,000/month and higher



We use a Credit Policy System to measure and reward:

 • Output & Quality – accuracy of drawings, clarity, reduced revisions

 • Speed & Reliability – hitting deadlines, responsiveness

 • Dedication – consistency, ownership, and professionalism

 • Long-Term Contribution – staying, improving, and helping the team grow



Important:

Salary is directly correlated with your Credit score in our system.

Higher credits = higher salary and opportunities.



What We Offer

 • Work on international landscape projects with growing long-term clients.

 • Training and mentoring to help you level up your skills.

 • Clear path from Junior to Mid / Senior Draftsman.

 • Remote work setup with performance-based incentives and bonuses.

 • A merit-based environment where your growth depends on your effort and results.

title: Guest Experience & Social Media VA — INDY GUIDE (Travel Platform)
description:
(Also read the how to apply section at the end)



Who We Are

INDY GUIDE is a Swiss travel platform that connects adventurous travelers with local guides, drivers, and tour operators in destinations most people have never heard of — think Mongolia, Kyrgyzstan, Uzbekistan, Georgia, and the Silk Road.

We have 2,500+ local hosts across Central Asia, the Caucasus, and beyond. Our travelers are independent, curious people planning trips that are anything but ordinary.

We are a small, remote team. You won't be a number here — you'll be the person our travelers and hosts interact with every day.



What You'll Actually Do

1. Be the bridge between travelers and hosts

Travelers message us on WhatsApp,
, Instagram, and through our platform when they're planning a trip to places like the Pamir Highway or the Gobi Desert. You'll respond to their questions, help them find the right host, and make sure conversations between travelers and hosts go smoothly.

When something goes wrong during a trip (a cancellation, a misunderstanding, a delayed driver), you're the person who steps in to coordinate a solution.

2. Manage our inbox across all channels

, Instagram DMs, WhatsApp, and platfor
ssages — you'll keep everything organized and make sure nobody waits more than a few hours for a response during your shift.

3. Grow our Instagram presence

We need someone who doesn't just post pretty pictures but actually engages — commenting on travel accounts, responding to DMs, starting conversations with potential travelers, and posting daily content (a mix of Reels, Stories, and grid posts). You'll use Canva for design and help us turn followers into actual bookings.



Who We're Looking For

This role is right for you if:



You've done customer support or community management before (Airbnb, travel, or hospitality experience is a big plus — but not required)

Your written English is strong enough that a native speaker wouldn't notice a difference

You're comfortable juggling WhatsApp,
, and Instagram at the same time without losing track of conversations

You know your way around Canva and Instagram (Reels, Stories, engagement strategies)

You can handle a frustrated traveler with patience and warmth — no scripts, just genuine problem-solving

You have reliable internet (minimum 20 Mbps) and a backup power solution for brownouts





What We Offer



A stable, long-term role with a growing company (we've been around since 2016)

You'll learn about destinations most VAs never get to work with

Room to grow — if you're great, there's more responsibility and better pay ahead

A founder who respects your time and communicates clearly





How to Apply — Read This Carefully

We receive hundreds of applications. To make sure yours gets read, please do the following:

Step 1: Record a short video (2–3 minutes max) using Loom, your phone, or any screen recorder. In the video:



Introduce yourself briefly

Pick ONE of these countries: Mongolia, Uzbekistan, or Georgia. Tell us one thing about that country that would make a traveler want to visit. (You can look it up — we just want to see how you communicate, not test your geography.)

Describe a time you dealt with a difficult customer or a stressful situation at work. What happened and what did you do?



Step 2: Share the video link in your application.

Step 3: In your cover letter, start with this sentence: "My favorite underrated travel destination is [your answer]."

Applications without a video will not be reviewed. We've learned from experience that written answers alone don't tell us what we need to know.

title: Remote CAD/CAM Programmer (CNC Router & Laser Specialist) - EnRoute
description:
ABOUT US:

KF Plastics is a leading plastic fabrication manufacturer based in Sydney, Australia. We specialize in high precision acrylic fabrication, engineering plastics, and signage. We are looking for a long term technical partner to manage our CNC programming remotely.



THE ROLE:

You will be our Remote CNC Department. You will log into our Sydney workstation (Remote Desktop) to prepare dxfs from customer files or drawings into "Ready-to-Cut" cnc files for our 3-Axis Flatbed Router and Laser Cutter.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:



Daily Batching: Log in daily to check the INPUT folder. Combine multiple jobs of the same material (e.g., "All 4.5mm Clear Acrylic") onto single sheets to maximize yield.



Drafting & Cleanup: Convert client PDFs/Sketches into clean DXF vectors. Verify scale against written dimensions (never trust the PDF scale).



Nesting (AlphaCam/EnRoute): Use EnRoute software to nest parts efficiently. Apply toolpaths using our specific Tool Library (Drill, Profile, Pocket).



Output Generation: Save Machine Files (.nc) and "Sheet Map" PDFs so our operators know which part belongs to which job.



REQUIREMENTS:



Software: Must be experienced with EnRoute (Nesting/Toolpathing) and SolidWorks/AutoCAD (2D Vectors).



Technical Knowledge: You must understand Flatbed Machining (Vacuum hold-down, Onion skins/Tabs, Dog-bone fillets for assembly).



Process Driven: You must follow our specific Folder Structure and Naming Conventions perfectly.



Hardware: Reliable High-Speed Internet is MANDATORY as you will be controlling a PC in Australia.



HOURLY RATE:

$8 - $12 USD / Hour (Depending on experience).

This is a Part-Time / Flexible role (approx. 10-15 hours/week) with potential to grow.



HOW TO APPLY:

Please reply with the following (Applications without these will be ignored):



A link to your SpeedTest.net result.



Your experience level with Solidworks/EnRoute (Years/Versions).



Answer this test question: If you are nesting 50 small acrylic letters (50mm high) on a flatbed router, what technique do you use to prevent them from moving or flying off the vacuum table?

Required Skills & Experience

Proven ability to create ads for DTC e-commerce / performance marketing 
, TikTok, Instagram)
