title: Craigslist Posting Pro
description:
Craigslist Posting Specialist (Remote / Part-Time)



**Position:** Craigslist Posting Pro

**Location:** Remote (U.S. focused)

**Type:** Part-Time (with opportunity to grow)

**Pay:** Hourly + performance incentives (based on results)



About Us



We’re a growing digital marketing company that helps businesses get more leads through SEO, websites, paid ads, and content marketing. We run nationwide hiring campaigns and need a **Craigslist expert** who knows how to post at scale *without getting flagged or burned*.



If you’ve successfully posted jobs on Craigslist across multiple cities and know how to keep ads live, refreshed, and converting — this role is for you.



---



Responsibilities



* Post **job ads on Craigslist** across multiple U.S. cities and states

* Follow best practices to **avoid flags, ghosting, or removals**

* Rotate titles, copy, formatting, and posting schedules

* Track posted ads (city, category, date, status)

* Repost and refresh ads as needed

* Follow company-provided templates and guidelines

* Communicate daily/weekly posting activity and results



---



Required Experience



* Proven experience posting **Craigslist job ads at scale**

* Strong understanding of:



* CL posting limits & timing

* Category selection

* IP/browser hygiene

* Title & copy variation

* Ability to work independently and follow SOPs

* Attention to detail and consistency



---



Bonus Skills (Not Required)



* Experience hiring for marketing, SEO, sales, or VA roles

* Familiarity with Google Sheets or basic tracking tools

* Experience managing multiple CL accounts (within guidelines)



---



 Compensation



* Competitive hourly pay (based on experience)

* Performance bonuses tied to:



* Ads staying live

* Applicant volume

* Lead quality

* Opportunity for long-term work as we scale



---



How to Apply

title: SEO Specialist (Part-Time) - Binary IT Solutions
description:
About Us

Binary IT Solutions (BITS) is a US-based IT services company with a simple mission: deliver reliable, innovative solutions that help businesses grow. We handle everything from web development and cloud solutions to hosting and communication systems for clients across North America and beyond.

We're a lean, results-driven team that values ownership, curiosity, and clear communication. If you like working with autonomy and want to grow alongside a company that's scaling, you're at the right place.



The Role

We're looking for an SEO Specialist to own SEO strategy and execution for our clients and internal properties.

You'll work flexible hours (async-friendly) with occasional afternoon check-ins and meetings in PH time. You'll report to our Project Manager but have direct access to leadership when needed.



What You'll Do

- Develop and execute SEO strategies for client websites and our internal properties

- On-page optimization: keyword research, content optimization, meta tags, site structure, technical SEO audits

- Off-page optimization: link building, outreach, reputation management

- Track, analyze, and report on SEO performance (rankings, traffic, conversions)

- Stay ahead of algorithm updates and industry best practices

- Collaborate with our team on content strategy and web development projects

- Communicate clearly with clients about progress, recommendations, and results



What We're Looking For

Must-haves:

- Mid-level experience in SEO (2-4 years preferred)

- Strong command of on-page and off-page SEO techniques

- Experience with Ahrefs, SEMrush, Moz, or similar tools (we'll provide if needed)

- Proven ability to improve rankings and organic traffic

- Excellent English communication skills (written and verbal)

- Very comfortable with Google Analytics, Search Console, and SEO fundamentals

- Self-starter mentality — you manage your own time and deliver without hand-holding

- Good attitude, open-minded learner who adapts to feedback and new ideas



Tea
ntality

Nice-to-haves:

- Familiarity with WordPress and basic HTML/CSS

- Experience managing multiple client accounts



Why Join Us?

- Flexibility — Work on your schedule, as long as the work gets done

- Growth potential — Start part-time, scale to full-time as needs increase

- Diverse projects — Work across industries and learn from varied client needs

- Direct impact — Small tea
ans your work matters and gets noticed. More personable relationship with coworkers

- Tools provided — We equip you with what you need to succeed

- Supportive team — Collaborative environment where questions are welcome

- Paid vacation days and holidays



HOW TO APPLY

:

title: E - Commerce CSR (with Australian Market experience)
description:
We are seeking a highly detail-oriented, commercially savvy, and execution-focused Customer Service & Sales Coordinator to support our retail operations. This role is critical in owning the customer relationship end-to-end, with a specific focus on order fulfilment within the Australian market (experience in both AU and US markets is a significant bonus).



The successful candidate will take full accountability for order processing, on-time delivery, and frontline customer-facing responsibility. Seniority is less important than discipline, a strong sense of ownership, and the ability to drive commercial outcomes through operational excellence.



Key Responsibilities

Order Processing & Sales Support

Manage end-to-end order processing with a primary focus on Australian retail partners.

Take full accountability for on-time delivery and tracking fulfillment timelines.

Follow structured SOPs while identifying opportunities to improve commercial efficiency.

Identify and resolve order discrepancies or delays proactively before they impact the customer.



Customer Relationship & Commercial Ownership

Serve as the primary, accountable point of contact for retailers and customers.

Own the customer relationship end-to-end, ensuring high-quality service and professional communication.

Apply a commercially savvy approach to problem-solving and relationship management.

Protect and strengthen long-term business relationships through proactive and thoughtful engagement.

title: Performance Video Editor (DTC Facebook Ads)
description:
We're looking for a highly skilled, marketing-minded video editor to join our eCommerce brand part-time on a remote basis. Full-time availability & higher salary opens up once quality assurance and expectations are met.



You will be responsible for editing short-form
 and Instagram ad creatives that drive real sales results, so you need to think like a marketer, not just an editor.



If you're someone who obsesses over hooks, understands why some videos stop the scroll and others don't, and can execute fast without sacrificing quality, this might be the position for you.



Responsibilities:



- Edit raw UGC and branded footage into high-converting short-form video ads for
 and Instagram

- Apply brand-consistent editing style across all creatives while adapting to different ad angles and formats

- Follow detailed creative briefs precisely and execute them without needing multiple revision rounds

- Stay up to date on what is currently performing in the DTC and skincare/beauty space

- Deliver edits on tight timelines, including same-day turnaround when needed





Requirements:



- Proficient in CapCut and/or Adobe Premiere Pro (please specify which in your application)

- Strong understanding of
 and Instagram paid ads, specifically what makes a video ad perform (hook rate, hold rate, pacing, CTR)

- Fluent in English with excellent written communication skills

- Experience editing for eCommerce or DTC brands is strongly preferred

- Highly organized, detail-oriented, and able to follow a brief without hand-holding

- Available on a consistent daily basis and responsive during working hours





Compensation and Growth:



- Pay-per-video model with highly competitive rates

- Monthly performance bonuses tied to KPI targets

- High performers are fast-tracked into increased salary + expanded roles into long-term growth opportunity as we scale aggressively





How to Apply:



To be considered, your application MUST include all of the following:



1) Your resume or CV highlighting relevant experience in video editing, eCommerce, marketing, or advertising

2) A portfolio of past video editing work, specifically ad creatives or short-form content (links preferred)

3) Written answers to all four applicant questions below



Applications missing any of these three items will be automatically denied.



Applicant Questions:



1) Walk us through your experience editing video ads for
 or Instagram. What tools do you use (CapCut, Premiere Pro, other), and what brands or products have you edited for? Do you have proof of viral/successful videos you've directly contributed to?



2) When you receive a creative brief, what is your process from the 
nt you open it to the 
nt you submit the final edit? Walk us through it step by step.



3) What separates a video ad that stops the scroll from one that gets skipped in the first 2 seconds? Give us a specific example from your own work or from an ad you've studied closely.



4) If you are selected to move forward, you will be asked to edit a brief sample video as part of the application process. Are you able to complete this, and what would your typical turnaround time be?

title: Bookkeeper *Superstar Only*
description:
We are looking for two experienced bookkeepers to join our finance team and take ownership of expense categorization, transaction reconciliation, accounts payable, and invoice processing across multiple legal entities.



The bookkeepers will work closely with the CFO, ensuring that all financial transactions are accurately recorded, categorized, and reconciled on a regular basis. This role is ideal for someone who is detail-oriented, organized, and comfortable managing financial data across multiple platforms — including Xero, Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and our custom CRM.



Key Responsibilities

- Categorize all expenses and transactions in Xero, ensuring accurate classification for reporting and compliance

- Reconcile transactions across multiple payment platforms, including Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and custom CRM tools

- Manage accounts payable, ensuring all invoices are properly reviewed, recorded, and scheduled for payment

- Assist with invoice processing, ensuring all vendor invoices are accurately documented and match purchase orders where applicable

- Work closely with the CFO to provide up-to-date financial records for monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting

- Ensure all financial data is accurate and properly organized to support compliance across multiple jurisdictions

- Flag discrepancies or unusual transactions for review by the CFO



What We’re Looking For

- At least 5 years of experience in bookkeeping and expense reconciliation

- Strong proficiency in Xero

- Experience working with Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and custom CRMs

- Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

- Experience handling multi-entity, multi-currency financial data preferred

- Comfortable working in a remote-first environment

- Fluent in English, both written and spoken

- Stable high-speed internet connection

- Conducive work environment



Working Schedule

- Full-time opportunity

- Remote work setup (Philippines-based applicants only)



Benefits

- Competitive pay

- Training and growth opportunities

- Opportunity to work with a fast-growing content-driven company



Salary range

- Php 40,000 - Php 65,000 (based on experience)

title: Long-Form Cinematic Video Editor
description:
I’m currently looking for a long-form video editor to join my Sims 4 Let’s Play storytelling-style channel in a long-term role focused on romantic. cinematic, emotionally driven content.



This may be the perfect fit for you if you genuinely love romantic storytelling — the kind that builds tension slowly, lingers on meaningful glances, and shapes scenes with intention rather than speed. My channel leans heavily into aesthetic pacing, character development, and emotionally immersive edits. Episodes typically range between 45–90 minutes and are structured more like episodic television than standard gameplay videos, with a mixture of live gameplay segments and short, scripted cinematic scenes.



Experience with The Sims 4 is not required. What matters most is your ability to shape narrative arcs, refine pacing, integrate music thoughtfully, and produce polished long-form content at a high standard on a weekly basis.

This role begins at 8 hours per week and is intended to be long term. I am not looking for freelance project-based work, but rather someone interested in growing in this position over time, with room for expanded responsibilities as the channel continues to develop.



Required Skills:



- Experience editing long-form content 



- Strong proficiency in video editing software such as: Adobe Premiere Pro, CapCut, DaVinci Resolve, Final Cut Pro etc.



- Strong understanding of pacing, emotional beats, and narrative cohesion



- Ability to integrate music and sound design intentionally



- Ability to deliver videos to a high standard within assigned deadlines



- Strong communication and reliability





Role Structure & Compensation:



- This role begins at 8 hours per week focused exclusively on long-form editing.



- Compensation ranges from $5–$7USD per hour, depending on experience, portfolio strength, and demonstrated ability to execute cinematic long-form content.



- As the channel grows, there is opportunity for expanded hours and increased responsibility over time. I value long-term collaboration and invest in editors who consistently deliver strong work and communicate well.



To Apply:



- Please send an e-mail to 
 with the subject line:

[Your Name] – Long Form Cinematic Video Editor – C7





Please Include:



- A portfolio showcasing long-form editing work (applications without a portfolio will not be considered)



- A brief note explaining why romantic, cinematic storytelling interests you



- Your proficiency with editing software 



- Your current weekly availability (in hours)



- Your salary expectations (USD hourly rate)



- Your availability to interview within the next three days



This is a collaborative role for someone who takes pride in refined storytelling and wants to be part of building something intentionally from the ground up.

title: Operations & Task Compliance Coordinator (Part-Time, Remote)sk
description:
Posting: Operations & Task Compliance Coordinator

Schedule: Part-Time (2–4 hours per day)

Location:  Remote

Reports To: CEO/Owner



---



About MNT Scientific



MNT Scientific is a growing, insurance-based nutrition practice dedicated to improving the health of Americans through evidence-based medical nutrition therapy delivered by Registered Dietitians. Our mission is to provide high-quality, accessible, insurance-covered nutrition consultations that improve long-term health outcomes.



We are currently a small but expanding organization with four full-time administrative staff, one full-time Registered Dietitian, and another RD joining the practice. We operate as a startup in growth mode and are actively engaged in research and development to determine the most effective ways to scale responsibly while maintaining high clinical and operational standards.



---



Position Overview



We are seeking a highly organized, detail-oriented **Operations & Task Compliance Coordinator** to ensure consistent follow-through on internal operational tasks. This is a preventative, systems-focused role designed to strengthen execution, improve accountability, and reduce operational inefficiencies.



This is NOT a supervisory role. The Coordinator will not assign tasks or manage staff performance directly. Instead, this individual will:



* Be included (copied  - CC'ed) on internal communications involving assigned tasks

* Extract and summarize tasks clearly and succinctly

* Ensure each task has a designated owner and deadline

* Monitor task completion

* Provide professional, friendly reminders

* Escalate non-completion appropriately



The primary objective of this role is operational consistency and execution reliability.



This individual will report directly to the CEO/Owner.



---



Core Responsibilities



* Monitor and track assigned operational tasks daily

* Maintain a structured task tracking system

* Send timely reminders prior to deadlines

* Follow up on incomplete tasks

* Escalate repeated non-completion by copying leadership on communications

* Participate in staff meetings and development sessions

* Support workflow optimization initiatives



Over time, additional minor responsibilities may be added, such as:



* Phone answering during defined coverage windows

* Substituting for administrative staff during absences

* Serving as an additional assistant to the CEO as needed



---



Required Qualifications



* Exceptional command of the English language (written and oral)

* Minimum typing speed of **60 words per minute**

* Ability to draft clear, professional communication

* Strong independent work ethic and self-management skills

* High attention to detail

* Excellent organizational and follow-through capability

* Comfortable using monitoring software

* Willingness to obtain a **HIPAA Compliance Certificate**



---



Technical Requirements



* Reliable high-speed internet connection

* Backup internet option available

* Video conferencing capability

* Computer with sufficient CPU power to run:



  * AI software

  * Video conferencing

  * Multiple programs simultaneously



---



Ideal Candidate Traits



* Calm, neutral, professional communicator

* Not reactive or emotionally driven

* Process-oriented and systematic

* Comfortable in startup environments

* Interested in contributing to a growing organization



---



Why This Role Matters



As a scaling healthcare organization, operational reliability is critical. This role protects clinical quality, revenue integrity, and staff morale by ensuring consistent task execution. The Coordinator helps leadership focus on patient care, research, and strategic growth rather than reactive correction.



---



Growth Potential



As the organization expands, this role may grow in scope and responsibility based on demonstrated performance and company needs.



---



If you are highly organized, detail-driven, and motivated to help build operational excellence within a growing healthcare organization, we welcome your application.



Please submit:



* Resume

* Typing speed verification

* Brief statement explaining why you are a strong fit for a high-accountability operational role



We look forward to hearing from you.



Best regards,

Patrick Traynor

CEO, MNT Scientific

title: Inventory Auditor (Part Time)
description:
Job Overview



We are looking for a part-time, independent Inventory Auditor to conduct a monthly onsite physical inventory count of our natural stone slabs and warehouse supplies. The primary responsibility is to verify the accuracy of our inventory records and ensure that actual stock matches system quantities.



The auditor will also prepare and submit a monthly inventory audit report to management.



?



Key Responsibilities



Onsite Physical Count

 • Conduct onsite physical counting of:

 • Natural stone slabs (marble, granite, quartzite, etc.)

 • Sintered stone and large surfaces (if applicable)

 • Warehouse materials, accessories, and installation supplies

 • Verify slab quantities and measurements when necessary



Inventory Accuracy Verification

 • Compare physical counts against inventory records (Excel or inventory system)

 • Confirm whether inventory balances are accurate

 • Identify shortages, overages, and discrepancies

 • Review stock movement including receiving, releases, transfers, and returns



Monthly Reporting

 • Prepare and submit a Monthly Inventory Audit Report including:

 • Actual vs recorded quantities

 • Variances and discrepancies

 • Accuracy status of inventory

 • Missing or high-value items

 • Observations and recommendations for improvement

 • Report must be submitted by the end of each month



?



Work Arrangement

 • Part-time / project-based

 • Onsite work required

 • Inventory audit conducted once per month

 • Reports directly to Owner / Management



?



Qualifications

 • CPA preferred but not required

 • Experience in inventory audit, accounting, or warehouse operations

 • Experience handling high-value materials (construction materials, stone, hardware, or similar) is an advantage

 • Strong attention to detail and integrity

 • Proficient in Excel

 • Independent and reliable

I am looking for a reliable and detail-oriented Shopify Store Builder to help me create branded dropshipping stores based on competitor examples.



This is a long-term position.



You will be responsible for building simple but clean Shopify stores from scratch using competitor websites as references.



Each store will contain only 2–3 products.



?



Your Responsibilities:



• Build Shopify stores using premium themes

• Recreate competitor website layouts and structure

• Customize theme sections (basic Liquid / CSS edits)

• Upload products and organize product pages

• Create product images using AI tools (Nano Banana, Chat GPT,...)

• Ensure clean, branded, and fast design



?



Requirements:



• Experience building Shopify stores

• Ability to accurately replicate competitor websites

• Basic knowledge of Shopify Liquid / HTML / CSS

• Strong attention to detail and ability to work independently



?



Work Details:



• Long-term position

• Approximately 1 store per week

• Each store contains only 2–3 products

title: Creative Operations Coordinator (Full time)
description:
Role: Content Coordinator - Content Execution & Quality Control

This is an execution and coordination role, not a strategy or idea role.

Hours: Full-time (40 hours/week)

Location: Remote

Salary: ?40,000 – ?65,000 PHP/month (based on experience)

Reports to: Creative Strategist

Works closely with: Video Editors & Designers



About us:

We’re a fast-growing Australian eCommerce brand in the sleep & wellness space, helping people sleep better through high-quality, thoughtfully designed products.



We produce a high volume of short-form video, ads, and creative assets across paid ads and social — and we care a lot about quality, consistency, and execution.



We’re now looking for a Content Coordinator to help keep our creative pipeline organised, on time, and to a high standard.



About the Role



This is a coordination and quality-control role, not a strategy or idea role.



You’ll work closely with our Creative Strategist, who will provide:



Clear creative ideas



Detailed briefs



Direction on what needs to be produced



Your job is to:



Take those briefs



Coordinate with video editors and designers



Ensure all content is delivered correctly, on time, to a high standard, and within budget



You’ll be the person making sure nothing slips through the cracks.



What You’ll Be Responsible For



Content Coordination



Receive and understand creative briefs from the Creative Strategist



Assign tasks to video editors and designers



Clearly communicate expectations, deliverables, and deadlines



Quality Control



Review all edits against the brief



Check pacing, captions, formatting, brand consistency, and overall quality



Request revisions when needed, with clear and actionable feedback



Project Management



Track multiple pieces of content at once



Follow up with editors to ensure deadlines are met



Proactively flag issues before they become problems



Budget & Efficiency Awareness



Be mindful of revision rounds and time spent



Help keep projects efficient and on budget



Organisation & Communication



Keep files, feedback, and folders organised



Provide clear updates on progress



Communicate professionally with creatives and the internal team



This Role Is a Great Fit If You:



Are highly organised and detail-oriented



Are comfortable managing creatives and giving feedback



Have great taste and feel for good ads and content



Care deeply about quality and consistency



Are proactive and don’t wait to be told to follow up



Can manage multiple tasks without feeling overwhelmed



Prefer execution and ownership over “idea-only” work



This Role Is NOT a Fit If You:



Primarily want to come up with ideas or strategies



Avoid giving feedback or requesting revisions



Struggle with deadlines or follow-ups



Dislike structure, checklists, or process



Need constant supervision



Required Skills & Experience



Experience coordinating content, creative, or media projects



Strong written English (for briefs, feedback, and communication)



Familiarity with short-form video content (ads, Reels, TikTok, etc.)



Basic understanding of video editing workflows



Nice to Have (Not Required)



Hands-on experience in video editing or graphic design



Strong creative taste and ability to assess pacing, captions, and visual quality



Experience working with editors and designers



Note: This is not an editing or design role. Editing/design experience is a plus only if it helps you give better feedback and manage creative quality.



How to Apply - Fill the form below:

title: Performance Video Editor
description:
Location: Remote / Hybrid

Type: Part-time or Contract (open to discussion)



The Role



We’re looking for a sharp, reliable Video Editor who knows how to turn raw footage into compelling stories that perform. This role is about clarity, pacing, and judgment, not just cutting clips. You’ll work closely with creative and marketing teams to produce video assets built for attention, retention, and results across multiple platforms.



This role includes editing original content, creating performance-driven ad assets, and repurposing long-form creator content into high-impact short-form. A strong eye for selecting and integrating on-brand B-roll is essential.



If you obsess over the first 1–3 seconds, understand hooks instinctively, and believe great editing should feel effortless, this role will suit you.



What You’ll Do

- Edit short- and long-form video content for digital platforms (social, web, paid media)

- Create performance-focused video assets for Meta, YouTube, TikTok, and other channels

- Repurpose long-form creator content into short-form and social-first edits

- Source and integrate complementary B-roll from stock libraries and relevant sources to elevate storytelling

- Shape raw footage into polished narratives with strong pacing and retention in mind

- Add graphics, sound design, music, and light motion where it meaningfully improves performance

- Iterate edits based on performance data and feedback

- Collaborate closely with creative and marketing teams to align edits with campaign goals

- Own projects end-to-end with minimal oversight

- Maintain clean project files, naming conventions, and version control



What We’re Looking For

- 3+ years of professional video editing experience

- Strong command of Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, and After Effects (or equivalent)

- Excellent storytelling instincts and editorial judgment

- Clear understanding of platform-specific formats and audience behaviour

- Ability to source and integrate high-quality B-roll that feels cohesive and on-brand

- Comfortable working in a performance-driven environment with feedback loops

- Organised, dependable, and deadline-focused

- Portfolio that demonstrates taste and intent, not just technical execution



Big Plus

- Experience editing Meta ads or other paid media

- Familiarity with marketing metrics (CTR, retention, hook rate, conversions)

- Experience collaborating with growth, paid media, or performance marketing teams

- Ability to balance speed, quality, and results without drama



Why This Role

- Your work directly impacts growth and outcomes

- Clear expectations, strong creative direction, and real ownership

- High standards, respectful collaboration, and room to grow

- Competitive compensation based on experience



How to Apply

Send your resume and a live URL link to your portfolio or reel to 
 without a viewable portfolio link will not be considered. Performance-focused work is strongly encouraged.



Final candidates may be asked to complete a short test edit.

title: TikTok/Reels Video Content Creator
description:
Hours: 20 hours/week (flexible scheduling, opportunity to expand to 40 hours)

Start Date: Immediate start



About the Role

- We're seeking a skilled Tiktok video creator to produce engaging short-form content for TikTok and Instagram Reels. This role starts at 20 hours per week with strong potential to transition into a full-time 40-hour position based on performance and business growth. The creator needs to be an anime fan and needs to have watched at least 80 anime in their lifetime.



Important: to apply for this position, it's required for you to fill in this form as well 
. And we will reach out for next steps.  



About us

- We are a technology startup based in the US. We are launching a mobile app that allows Gen Zs and millennials to watch their favorite shows and anime together. As part of the launch, we are starting our social media efforts, which you will be involved with. 



Key Responsibilities

- Create compelling, trend-aware video content for TikTok and Instagram Reels focused on characters / shows / anime themes

- Develop and execute content calendars aligned with show releases, trends, and community interests

- Edit videos with dynamic pacing, transitions, effects, and music that resonate with Gen Zs

- Monitor social media trends to keep content fresh and relevant

- Engage with community comments and feedback to build audience relationships

- Track performance metrics and optimize content strategy based on data insights

- Collaborate on broader content strategy and campaign development



Required Qualifications



- Video Creation Experience: Proven track record creating AMVs (Anime Music Videos) and other anime-related video content

- Technical Skills: Proficiency in video editing software (Adobe Premiere, After Effects, CapCut, or similar)

- Anime Expertise: Must have watched 80+ anime series/films throughout your life and possess deep knowledge of anime culture, genres, and community

- Platform Knowledge: Strong understanding of TikTok and Instagram Reels algorithms, trends, and best practices

- Creative Eye: Ability to match scenes, music, and effects to create emotionally engaging content

- Time Management: Ability to consistently produce multiple videos per week while maintaining quality



Preferred Qualifications

- Successfully grown personal social media accounts to significant follower counts  (please provide your account links)

title: Virtual Assistant (Marketing Agency Support - Social Media)
description:
ABOUT US



We’re a small and growing marketing agency that helps hospitality, wellness, and service-based businesses tell their stories in a way that connects with people. 



Our strategic approach is personal, rooted in kindness, curiosity, and collaboration. We love bringing brands to life through words, visuals, and authentic storytelling.



This is an early-stage role, meaning you’ll work closely with the founder and core team while helping shape how our content and social presence grow. The individual joining this role will have the chance to build something special with us.



THE ROLE



We’re looking for a person who is passionate about social media and they like to collaborate and bring creative ideas to life while staying aligned with brand strategy. 



Your first focus will be supporting a core client while learning our systems, brand standards, and creative approach. 



Success in this will provide the opportunity to expand into additional brands and internal agency content as we grow.



This role is both hands-on and developmental, you’ll create and post content while learning and contributing to deeper strategy, research, and optimization over time.



WHAT YOU’LL DO



Social Media & Content 

• Create on-brand social media content (graphics, short-form videos, captions)

• Must be know Canva and have a creative design understanding

• Understand how to work with content calendars and brand guidelines

• Understand brand tone, visuals, and message across multiple brands

• Repurpose content across platforms (Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn) thoughtfully, not one-size-fits-all style



Video Creation & Editing

• Ability basic edits to short-form and long-form video content (Reels, Shorts, Stories, clips)

• Add captions, hooks, branding, and CTAs

• Repurpose videos for different platforms and use cases



Analytics & Optimization

• Review content performance and engagement

• Help identify what drives awareness vs. leads

• Adjust future content based on insights and results



AI & Tools

• Awareness and use of AI tools to work smarter (editing, ideation, repurposing, workflows)

• Our agency is AI-forward, we understand that this provides leverage and knowledge but does not replace authenticity.

• Be open to learning and experimenting with new tools and systems



WHO YOU ARE



• Reliable, thoughtful, and detail-oriented

• Communicates clearly and professionally in English

• Enjoys learning new tools and growing into new skills

• Creative at heart - someone who sees how design and storytelling connect

• Curious about strategy and interested in learning why things work

• Comfortable receiving feedback and iterating quickly

• Excited to grow with a small team and help build something meaningful that helps small businesses find further success.



NICE-TO-HAVE SKILLS (ASSETS)



• Experience with GoHighLevel (or similar social scheduling tools)

• Understanding of basic SEO and content optimization

• Experience supporting ads with creative assets (graphics or video)

• Familiarity with multiple tools like CapCut, Premiere, Final Cut, or similar

• Knowledge of AI tools such as ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini and other Google tools, Midjourney, Higgsfield etc.) to provide smarter workflows

• Workflow automations

• Comfort collaborating In a team environment

• Familiarity with ClickUp or similar project management tools

• Experience supporting podcasts or long-form content repurposing



COMPENSATION & GROWTH



• 24 hrs/week to start, with the intention of increasing responsibility and hours as the role proves successful.

• You’ll be trained, supported, and included in strategy



APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS



Please include the word PIZZA in your subject line so we know you read the full post.



WHY THIS ROLE MATTERS



This role directly supports our clients, our internal growth, and the future of the company. You won’t just be “posting content” you will help shape how brands show up online, how stories are told, and how scalable systems are built.



We believe great businesses are built through connection and we’re looking for someone who wants to build with us, not just work for us. If that excites you, we’d love to meet you

title: Customer Services Representative
description:
Customer Services Job Description

Business Overview

Fields Luxury Limited owns and sells its portfolio of watch brands including Swan & Edgar watches.

Purpose of the Role

To provide reliable, professional first-line customer support during UK business hours, protecting customer experience and freeing ops and leadership time for our watch brands.

Key Responsibilities

- Respond to customer enquiries via
 and ticketing system (Zendesk)

- Handle inbound phone calls

- Provide order status updates and delivery support

- Manage returns and exchanges in line with SOPs

- Escalate complex issues clearly and promptly

- Follow scripts, macros tone of voice, and escalation rules

- Maintain accurate notes and ticket updates

Required Skills & Experience

- Prior ecommerce customer service experience (5 years minimum)

- Order processing, tracking, courier liaison, returns, refunds and charge back experience

- Excellent written and spoken English

- Calm, professional phone manner

- Comfortable following SOPs and scripts

- Detail-oriented and process-driven

- Goes above and beyond to delight customers

- Ability to work independently and on weekends

- Working Setup

Working Schedule (2 Phases)

Phase 1 - Training - Period: 2.5-3 weeks

- Monday - Friday: 9am-5pm UK Time

Phase 2 - Post Training (after training period)

- Friday - Tuesday (Friday, Saturday, Sunday, Monday & Tuesday): 9am - 5pm UK Time

N.B. weekend work will be independent as the rest of our team works Monday - Friday.

Working Nature & Set Up

- Fully remote

- Equipment (not provided but must have): Computer/laptop (video camera enabled), headset (clear mic and headphones), quiet working area, fast and reliable internet

- Tools: Our tools: Outlook,
, Zendesk, Shopify/CRM (training provided)

KPIs

- Improved customer response time & satisfaction

title: Website and Social Media Assistant- Health Industry
description:
I am an Australian naturopath and I am after an assistant to help upgrade my website (Squarespace/Weebly with Simple Clinic Integration) and to effectively use social media to increase presence, awareness and ultimately bookings . There may be other tasks including monthly newsletters, blogs, etc. Must be proficient in English, and be proficient and experienced in using weebly/ Square space and Canva. Experience with SimpleClinic integration desirable.

Some tasks may involve:

• Complete website visual and content refresh

• Cleaner structure and improved navigation

• Updated pages

• Clear booking pathways and calls to action

• Consistent branding across all website pages

• Logo refresh 

• Possible new business card design

• Canva template designs

Social Media Clean-Up & Strategy

- Simplifying platforms, improving visual consistency, creating content that supports bookings.

• Instagram grid reset with a new visual direction

•
 page updates

• Removal of cluttered, ad-style content

• Clear content themes aligned with services and website messaging

• Weekly content rhythm and posting schedule

• Strategic use of posts as an engagement and redirection tool

 And other tasks as required.

The successful applicant must be able to work autonomously with my direction. The position will be project based to begin with and may be temporary. There will be an initial trial period. Experience in the natural health industry preferred. You will be required to submit a daily report and we would use Zoo
etings for communication as required. The position may grow and evolve to the changing needs of the business.  

In your application please provide two examples of previous experience showing the work that you have done including 2 contactable references for these. 

Please provide your resume, portfolio and tell me what you love about Naturopathy.

title: Project manager for Web Design Team
description:
We are looking for a structured, detail-oriented, and proactive Project Manager to lead our Filipino development team working on websites for Danish small and medium-sized businesses.



You will be responsible for translating client feedback (in Danish) into clear, actionable development tasks in English, ensuring quality control, managing deadlines, and communicating daily with our Danish Key Account Manager.



YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:

- Translate Danish client feedback into structured development tasks

- Break down requests into clear, assignable subtasks

- Identify dependencies and missing information

- Prioritize tasks and manage deadlines

- Perform quality assurance before delivery

- Lead and coordinate a team of 5 developers

- Ensure projects move forward without delays



WORK SCOPE:

This is a long-term position with full operational responsibility for project delivery.



If the trial task is completed successfully, you will be responsible for managing multiple website projects simultaneously and ensuring consistent, high-quality output.



TRIAL TASK:

You will receive:

- 3 examples of Danish client feedback

- A link to a live website



Your task is to:

- Translate the feedback into English

- Structure it into clear, actionable development tasks

- Include priorities, dependencies, assumptions, and questions (if needed)

- Deliver the output in a format ready to assign to developers



Estimated completion time: 30–50 minutes.



TO APPLY:

Please fill out the application form below and include:

- Your estimated time to complete the trial task

- Your monthly salary expectation

- Your availability (hours per week)

- Your experience managing developers

- Your requested payment for the trial task



Application form:





(Only applicants who complete the form and trial task will be reviewed.)

title: Architect with knowledge in Corel and AI and experience in Industrial / Manufacturing Layouts

title: Join our team! We need an Experienced Project Manager
description:
We’re looking for a detail-oriented, proactive Project Manager to join our remote team. This role is ideal for someone with experience in digital marketing or creative agencies who can manage multiple projects, communicate clearly with clients, and keep teams on track and accountable. You'll serve as the bridge between our clients and internal teams—making sure deliverables are met, expectations are clear, and timelines are followed.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Project Coordination: Plan, organize, and oversee project timelines, deliverables, and workflows for multiple SaaS, tech and software clients.

Client Communication: Act as the main point of contact for clients, ensuring regular updates, smooth communication, and stakeholder satisfaction.

Team Collaboration: Work closely with SEO, Content, and Outreach teams to align goals, remove blockers, and ensure high-quality output.

Workflow Management: Use project management tools (like Trello, Airtable, etc.) to track task progress, identify risks, and keep projects running efficiently.

Reporting & Feedback: Monitor key deliverables and provide clear, data-backed progress reports to clients and internal stakeholders.



QUALIFICATIONS

1–2+ years of project management experience in a digital marketing agency or similar client-service environment.

Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple timelines and deadlines.

Excellent communication skills—comfortable managing both internal and external stakeholders.

Familiarity with digital marketing workflows and SEO background is a strong plus

Proactive problem-solver with a team-first mindset.



WHAT WE OFFER

Compensation: Commensurate to experience

Remote-first: Work from anywhere in the world

Flexible work environment with supportive team culture

Opportunity to work with innovative SaaS brands

Clear growth paths and skill development opportunities

Transparent, goal-driven workflows



HOW TO APPLY

Submission Requirements (Mandatory)

At MADX, we prioritize clear communication and the ability to follow technical specifications. To ensure your application is processed, you must follow these naming conventions when applying:



Subject line: "MADX Project Manager Application - [Your Name]"

Start your cover letter with the word 'Accelerator'



Interested candidates should submit their resume and a brief cover letter explaining why they are a good fit for this role to 
 ensure you follow the mandatory requirements above.



Selected candidates will be invited for an interview to discuss their experience and suitability for the role.

title: Video Contributor(Iphone 11 or newer and head mount)
description:
This project focuses on collecting first-person (POV) video to train AI and robotics models. As a contributor, you will record POV footage of your everyday household and work activities using a head-mounted iPhone and our specific recording application.

Contributors from any country are welcome to participate. You must already have or be willing to purchase an iPhone 11 or newer and a head-mount for it.



Recording should be done with a head mount—?neck and chest mounts are not acceptable.

Each video you upload must be of a specific task, and NOT a mix of tasks. For example, one video upload should not have you doing both cooking and laundry. Instead, you should record separate videos of cooking and then doing the laundry, and upload both separately.

Ideally, you should record a mix of tasks between 15-30 minutes long.

The space where you record your video should have excellent lighting.

Keep the camera steady with minimal shaking.

All submitted footage must exclude any other individuals' faces unless they directly consent. Additionally, no third party music is permitted in the footage to avoid copyright violations.

No children should appear in the submitted footage.

Minimize external noise during the recording–especially talking–so the audio of the task can be captured clearly and keep the camera as steady as possible throughout the recording.

Complete each task from start to finish without walking away or leaving to do another task or take a break.

Tasks should be performed while either standing up, sitting on a chair/stool, not while sitting on the ground.

Perform all activities in a controlled, slow manner.
